Key Match Events: Argentina scored the first goal of the match in the 49th minute through Julián Álvarez.
Canada came close to an equalizer in the first half but missed several chances.
Maxime Crépeau made several crucial saves, including one against Lionel Messi.
Argentina scored their second goal in the 88th minute through Lautaro Martínez.
Pre-Game Insights: Canada played the same starting lineup as their friendly against France, showing consistency.
Argentina fielded their strongest possible side, including Lionel Messi and Ángel Di María.
Argentina's coach, Lionel Scaloni, made tactical adjustments during the match, bringing on Giovani Lo Celso and Nicolas Otamendi.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada's coach Jesse Marsch praised the team's performance and effort but expressed frustration at the missed opportunities.
Maxime Crépeau was lauded for his standout performance, making several key saves.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada had 56% duel success and won 73% of their attempted tackles in the first half.
The match saw several yellow cards, including ones for Rodrigo De Paul, Ismaël Koné, Giovani Lo Celso, and Derek Cornelius.
